Microbee CoreWars Blogging About Me

Blogging

I thought it my be a good idea to track the progress of my various software projects.

Mainly as I am notoriously bad at documentation

But also give me a way to track my progress (or lack thereof). And (maybe) provide something interest to any readers.

After checking out the various bogging options, I stumbled across GitHub Pages

It ticked a few boxes:

  1. It was free
  2. It was open source
  3. I was intrigued by the ability to use Jekyll as the engine to build a website with lots of bells and whistles
  4. It was free

There are a plethora of complex and visuallt appealing themes available ( at all price points ).

A sample of some of these themes can be found at Jekyllthemes.io

Iâ€™ve ended up building this site using the default Jekyll theme Minima

But I hope to migrate it to something a little more visually stylish as I explore the capabilities of Jeykll and to document my journey.
